Issues.Body:

https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/search?l=C%23&q=arraylist

**all versions**

Issues.Title: Resources used in ListBox ItemTemplate not properly loaded
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`) 5.0.16 
* Windows version: (`winver`)   21H1 19043.1645
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
  No, interestingly the XAML Designer does not show the problem 
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
When I load a <Rectangle> as a resource to display inside a button, which is used inside the item template for the list box, the rectangle is only displayed for the last item in the list. It should be shown on all items.

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

When running the example below, I see
![Example for list box output](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/98807064/163175907-23d87e85-56a1-4ee3-8fc8-546a451bafb6.png)

On the left the rectangle loaded via a resource, and on the right the directly specified rectangle. Both sides should be the same, but are not.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
 
 **Minimal repro:**
For MainWindow.xaml, in a standard WPF App generated via Visual Studio,
``` 
  <Window.Resources>
    <LinearGradientBrush x:Key="GreenBackground" StartPoint="0,0" EndPoint="0,1">
      <GradientStop Color="#FFE4F9F2" Offset="0"/>
      <GradientStop Color="#FFA2F1D7" Offset="2.5"/>
    </LinearGradientBrush>
    <Rectangle Width="16" Height="16" x:Key="Icon-Green" Fill="{StaticResource GreenBackground}"/>
  </Window.Resources>
  <Grid>
    <ListBox Name="lstDemo" Margin="2,29,2,0">
      <ListBox.ItemTemplate>
        <DataTemplate>
          <Grid Margin="4">
            <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
              <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto"/>
              <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto"/>
            </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <Button Content="{StaticResource Icon-Green}" Width="40" Height="24" Margin="2"/>
            <Button Width="40" Height="24" Margin="2" Grid.Column="1">
              <Rectangle Width="16" Height="16" Fill="{StaticResource GreenBackground}"/>
            </Button>
          </Grid>
        </DataTemplate>
      </ListBox.ItemTemplate>
    </ListBox>
  </Grid>
```
and in MainWindow.xaml.cs
```       
        public MainWindow() {
            InitializeComponent();
            lstDemo.ItemsSource = new int[] { 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6 };
        }
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Resources used in ListBox ItemTemplate not properly loaded" (#6416)

Issues.Title: The first point in StylusPlugin is wrong when use the high DPI
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview1, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Windows version: (`winver`)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes/No
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/main/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**

After https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/2891 , we call calculate the point with `stylusDevice.CriticalActiveSource`. But the  `stylusDevice.CriticalActiveSource` must be null when first touch down, because the wpf do not touch any element and do not get the AcitveSource before first touch down.
 
 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->

All of the StylusPlugin will reviece the wrong coordinate point.
 
 **Expected behavior:**

These points can be calculated correctly.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

Create an emtpy WPF project and add the StylusPlugin and then output the point received.

cc @rladuca @singhashish-wpf
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The first point in StylusPlugin is wrong when use the high DPI" (#6415)

Issues.Title: Dispatcher MemoryLeak
Issues.Body:
When investigating a memory leak using a process dump from a client, I noticed that there are lots of Dispatchers


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20905599/163154167-f171d5d4-016a-46ab-a044-e2a4c9502c75.png)

When you take a close look on the first screenshot at paths to root it looks like Dispatchers are holding references of each other.
To my understanding a Dispatcher is connected to a Thread, so how can this happen? 





The actual problem is that those dispatchers seem to hold lots of references

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20905599/163164937-7eab28c3-dd20-4bba-85ab-7a1be58a5804.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20905599/163165000-ca808591-3dfe-4ad5-8d08-88384e897492.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20905599/163165015-cb0cf8bd-a0e1-454d-80cd-e98c97cf50ba.png)



Sadly I do not know how to reproduce this, I only have the process dump (3.5 GB).
The Application uses lots of FlowDocuments and some WindowsFormsHosts.

Observed in .net 4.8 on a TerminalServer without RemoteGFX (software rendering).
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20905599/163165206-96a3b3ee-27e2-4179-b99d-0a77374663fd.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dispatcher MemoryLeak" (#6412)

Issues.Title: .net 6: WriteableBitmap performance lower than Net framework 4.8.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".net 6: WriteableBitmap performance lower than Net framework 4.8." (#6411)

Issues.Title: WPF source code missing in Source Browser
Issues.Body:
Since a few days or weeks, i don't know exactly since when, WPF source code is missing on https://source.dot.net
As i don't know which team is responsible and since WinForms is still being included there i thought this might be the correct repo to report this issue.
If this is the wrong repo it would be nice to get a hint at where this should be reported or if it gets re-routed to the correct repo.

For example, browsing to https://source.dot.net/#q=frameworkelement only lists source code from PresentationBuildTasks but not from WPF itself.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WPF source code missing in Source Browser" (#6401)

Issues.Title: Absence of .net runtime in Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App package
Issues.Body:
Hi,

Recently install-scripts team has received an [issue](https://github.com/dotnet/install-scripts/issues/266) related to desktop environment installation.
We investigated this problem and found out that `Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App` archive doesn't contain the required files for fullfilling this request.

Could you help to deal with it or redirect it to a proper team?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Absence of .net runtime in Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App package" (#6398)
